page.title: 14RECREATION
page.content: At Furneux Pelham every home in the village has a television and some homes have two or more sets. Mostly people in the village watch television mainly to fill in the gaps between the times when they are not doing anything else. On Saturdays and Sundays when the programmes are not very good lots of people do things like horse riding and cycling which are popular hobbies. Sometimes people go to clubs like Scouts, Brownies, tennis, drama and swimming, but some people prefer to stay indoors drawing or writing or collecting things like stamps, stickers, china animals or rubbers. We don't often go to the pictures or theatre but entertain one another in our own homes like our parents.
